net.egartley.gamelib.objects

Class Entity

  • java.lang.Object
    • net.egartley.gamelib.abstracts.Entity
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    AnimatedEntity, StaticEntity

    public abstract class Entity
extends java.lang.Object
    An object or character that can rendered with a Sprite at a specified location
    See Also:
    AnimatedEntity, StaticEntity

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Entity(java.lang.String id)
      Creates a new entity with a randomly generated UUID, an initial speed of 1.0, then adds it to the entity store

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      protected void allowAllMovement()
      Allows the entity to move in all directions
      protected void annulCollisionEvent(EntityEntityCollisionEvent event)
      Cancels any movement restrictions imposed by the provided EntityEntityCollisionEvent
      private void drawBoundaries(java.awt.Graphics graphics)
      Draws all of the entity's boundaries
      (package private) void drawDebug(java.awt.Graphics graphics)
      Renders debug information, such as the entity's boundaries and "name tag"
      void drawFirstLayer(java.awt.Graphics graphics)
      Draws the first "layer" if isDualRendered is true (below the player)
      private void drawNameTag(java.awt.Graphics graphics)
      Draws the entity's "name tag", which is toString() with a half-opaque black background
      void drawSecondLayer(java.awt.Graphics graphics)
      Draws the second "layer" if isDualRendered is true (above the player)
      private void generateUUID()
      Generates a new value for uuid
      private boolean isAbove(Entity e)
      Returns whether or not the entity is "above" the other entity
      private boolean isBelow(Entity e)
      Returns whether or not the entity is "below" the other entity
      private boolean isLeftOf(Entity e)
      Returns whether or not the entity is to the "left" of the other entity
      private boolean isRightOf(Entity e)
      Returns whether or not the entity is to the "right" of the other entity
      void kill()
      "Kills" the entity by removing it from the entity store, but only if it is sector-specific
      protected void move(byte direction)
      Changes the entity's location (x and y) at a rate of speed per call.
      private void move(byte direction, EntityBoundary boundary)
      Updates the entity's location by speed, unless the specified boundary is outside of the game's window
      protected void onCollisionWithNonTraversableEntity(EntityEntityCollisionEvent event)
      Disallows movement opposite of the side of the collision.
      protected void onMove(byte direction)
      Called whenever the entity moves
      void render(java.awt.Graphics graphics)
      Renders the entity, using sprite, at (x, y)

      Sets the entity's boundaries
      protected abstract void setCollisions()
      Sets the entity's collisions
      void setSprite(int index)
      Sets the current sprite
      void tick()
      Calls EntityBoundary.tick() and EntityEntityCollision.tick()
      java.lang.String toString()
      Returns the entity as a string, in the format id#uuid

        Whether or not other entities, mainly the player, can walk over it or not

      • lastCollision

        public EntityEntityCollision lastCollision
        The most recent collision that has occurred for the entity. If no collisions have occurred within the entity's lifetime, this will be null

      • lastCollisionEvent

        public EntityEntityCollisionEvent lastCollisionEvent
        The most recent collision event to have occurred. This will be null if no collision event has yet to take place

        Constant Field Values

      • secondLayer

        protected java.awt.image.BufferedImage secondLayer
        If isDualRendered is true, render this after the player ("above")

      • setFontMetrics

        private boolean setFontMetrics
        Whether or not font metrics have been initialized. Since render(Graphics) is called about 60 times a second, and the resulting font metrics object will always be the same, there is no need to keep re-computing it each time render(Graphics) is called

      • speed

        public double speed
        The entity's speed (magnitude of its location change when moving)

      • sprite

        public Sprite sprite
        The sprite to use while rendering

        protected java.util.ArrayList<Sprite> sprites
        The entity's sprites

        public static final byte UP
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

      • uuid

        public int uuid
        The entity's unique identification number. Use id for user-friendly identification

      • x

        public double x
        The entity's x-axis coordinate

      • y

        public double y
        The entity's y-axis coordinate

        void drawDebug(java.awt.Graphics graphics)
        Renders debug information, such as the entity's boundaries and "name tag"

        Game.debug

      • drawFirstLayer

        public void drawFirstLayer(java.awt.Graphics graphics)
        Draws the first "layer" if isDualRendered is true (below the player)

      • drawNameTag

        private void drawNameTag(java.awt.Graphics graphics)
        Draws the entity's "name tag", which is toString() with a half-opaque black background

      • drawSecondLayer

        public void drawSecondLayer(java.awt.Graphics graphics)
        Draws the second "layer" if isDualRendered is true (above the player)

        private void generateUUID()
        Generates a new value for uuid
        See Also:
        Util.randomInt(int, int, boolean)

      • isAbove

        private boolean isAbove(Entity e)
        Returns whether or not the entity is "above" the other entity

      • isBelow

        private boolean isBelow(Entity e)
        Returns whether or not the entity is "below" the other entity

      • isLeftOf

        private boolean isLeftOf(Entity e)
        Returns whether or not the entity is to the "left" of the other entity

      • isRightOf

        private boolean isRightOf(Entity e)
        Returns whether or not the entity is to the "right" of the other entity

      • kill

        public void kill()
        "Kills" the entity by removing it from the entity store, but only if it is sector-specific

      • move

        protected void move(byte direction)
        Changes the entity's location (x and y) at a rate of speed per call. Since there is no boundary parameter, the entity's defaultBoundary will be used

      • move

        private void move(byte direction,
                  EntityBoundary boundary)
        Updates the entity's location by speed, unless the specified boundary is outside of the game's window

      • onCollisionWithNonTraversableEntity

        protected void onCollisionWithNonTraversableEntity(EntityEntityCollisionEvent event)
        Disallows movement opposite of the side of the collision. For example, if the player collided with a tree on its top side, downward movement would no longer be allowed until that collision is no longer active

      • onMove

        protected void onMove(byte direction)
        Called whenever the entity moves
        Parameters:
        direction - Which direction the entity moved in
        See Also:
        UP, DOWN, LEFT, RIGHT, move(byte)

      • render

        public void render(java.awt.Graphics graphics)
        Renders the entity, using sprite, at (x, y)

      • setBoundaries

        protected abstract void setBoundaries()
        Sets the entity's boundaries
        See Also:
        boundaries

      • setCollisions

        protected abstract void setCollisions()
        Sets the entity's collisions
        See Also:
        collisions

      • setSprite

        public void setSprite(int index)
        Sets the current sprite
        See Also:
        sprite

      • tick

        public void tick()
        Calls EntityBoundary.tick() and EntityEntityCollision.tick()
        See Also:
        boundaries, collisions

      • toString

        public java.lang.String toString()
        Returns the entity as a string, in the format id#uuid
        Overrides:
        toString in class java.lang.Object
        See Also:
        id, uuid
